Public NotInheritable Class InertiaRotationBehavior2D Inherits InertiaParameters2D

Docs.summary: Describes desired rotation behavior of an inertia processor.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property float DesiredDeceleration { float get(); void set(float value); };
member this.DesiredDeceleration : single with get, set

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the desired angular deceleration, in radians per millisecond squared.
Docs.value: The desired angular deceleration, in radians per millisecond squared.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property represents the desired angular deceleration to be used during the inertia operation. This property value is mutually exclusive with the <xref:System.Windows.Input.Manipulations.InertiaRotationBehavior2D.DesiredRotation%2A> property; setting this property will set <xref:System.Windows.Input.Manipulations.InertiaRotationBehavior2D.DesiredRotation%2A> to `NaN`. The default value for both this property and <xref:System.Windows.Input.Manipulations.InertiaRotationBehavior2D.DesiredRotation%2A> is `NaN`. You must set one or the other property before inertia processing starts.
<xref:System.Windows.Input.Manipulations.InertiaRotationBehavior2D.DesiredDeceleration%2A> must be a finite, non-negative number.
This property cannot be set while the inertia processor is running; otherwise, an exception is thrown.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property float DesiredRotation { float get(); void set(float value); };
member this.DesiredRotation : single with get, set

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the desired rotation, in radians.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property represents the desired ending rotation of the inertia operation. This property value is mutually exclusive with the <xref:System.Windows.Input.Manipulations.InertiaRotationBehavior2D.DesiredDeceleration%2A> property; setting this property will set <xref:System.Windows.Input.Manipulations.InertiaRotationBehavior2D.DesiredDeceleration%2A> to `NaN`. The default value for both this property and <xref:System.Windows.Input.Manipulations.InertiaRotationBehavior2D.DesiredDeceleration%2A> is `NaN`. You must set one or the other property before inertia processing starts.
<xref:System.Windows.Input.Manipulations.InertiaRotationBehavior2D.DesiredRotation%2A> must be a finite, non-negative number. The direction of rotation is determined by the <xref:System.Windows.Input.Manipulations.InertiaRotationBehavior2D.InitialVelocity%2A> property.
This property cannot be set while the inertia processor is running; otherwise, an exception is thrown.
## Examples In the following example, the <xref:System.Windows.Input.Manipulations.InertiaRotationBehavior2D.DesiredRotation%2A> property is set to enable inertia processing to rotate an object three-and-one-half times from its starting orientation.
[!code-csharp[ManipulationAPI#_ManipulationItem_SetDesiredRotation](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Misc/manipulationapi/cs/manipulationitem.xaml.cs#_manipulationitem_setdesiredrotation)]

MemberSignature.Value: public: property float InitialVelocity { float get(); void set(float value); };
member this.InitialVelocity : single with get, set

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the initial rotational velocity, in radians per millisecond.
Docs.value: The initial rotational velocity, in radians per millisecond.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The default value for this property is `NaN`. Leaving this property unchanged from the default or setting this property to zero (0) will disable rotational inertia.
This property cannot be set while the inertia processor is running; otherwise, an exception is thrown.
